Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese

Jump to Recipe

Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese is the ultimate comfort food that combines the creamy goodness of mac and cheese with the spicy kick of buffalo chicken. This hearty dish not only tantalizes your taste buds but also satisfies your cravings for something indulgent. Perfect for a family dinner, game day snack, or a potluck dish, this recipe features tender elbow macaroni enveloped in a rich cheese sauce, complemented by tender, shredded chicken and a zesty buffalo sauce. With just a handful of ingredients and minimal prep time, you can whip up a delightful meal that everyone will love. Whether you're a fan of spicy flavors or simply looking to elevate your traditional mac and cheese, this Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese is sure to become a favorite in your household. Get ready to dive into a bowl of cheesy, spicy goodness that will keep you coming back for more!

Ingredients

elbow macaroni

Use whole wheat elbow macaroni for a healthier option or gluten-free macaroni if needed. To enhance flavor, consider adding a pinch of salt to the boiling water.

shredded cheddar cheese

For a sharper flavor, use sharp cheddar cheese. You can also mix in other cheeses like Monterey Jack or Gouda for extra creaminess and depth. If you're avoiding dairy, try a vegan cheese alternative.

cream cheese

For a lighter version, use reduced-fat cream cheese. If you don't have cream cheese, mascarpone or ricotta can be good substitutes, but adjust the quantity to achieve the desired creaminess.

buffalo sauce

Adjust the amount of buffalo sauce to taste, depending on your spice preference. If you want a milder flavor, mix in some ranch dressing or sour cream. You can also use homemade buffalo sauce for a fresher taste.

cooked chicken, shredded

Rotisserie chicken works great for convenience, but you can also use leftover grilled or baked chicken. For a vegetarian version, substitute with shredded jackfruit or cauliflower.

butter

For a healthier option, substitute with olive oil or a plant-based butter. If you're looking for a richer flavor, consider using ghee.

milk

Use whole milk for a creamier texture, or substitute with almond milk or oat milk for a dairy-free version. If you want to enhance the flavor, consider using chicken broth instead.

salt

Always taste the dish before adding salt; the cheese and buffalo sauce can be quite salty already. Use kosher salt for better control over seasoning.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper adds more flavor than pre-ground. For added warmth, consider using cayenne pepper or smoked paprika.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Cook the Elbow Macaroni

    Begin by boiling a large pot of salted water. Add 8 oz of elbow macaroni and cook according to package instructions until al dente, usually around 7-8 minutes. Drain the macaroni and set aside. Tips: - Make sure to stir the macaroni occasionally while cooking to prevent sticking. - Reserve a little pasta water (about 1/4 cup) to adjust the sauce consistency if needed.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Cheese Sauce

    In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt 2 tbsp of butter. Once melted, add 1 cup of milk and 4 oz of cream cheese. Stir continuously until the mixture is smooth and creamy, avoiding any lumps. Notes: - Using low-fat cream cheese can be a healthier option, though it may change the texture slightly. - If you're in a hurry, you can microwave the cream cheese for a few seconds before adding it to the saucepan to soften it up.

  • Step 3: Add Cheddar and Buffalo Sauce

    Next, stir in 2 cups of shredded cheddar cheese and 1/2 cup of buffalo sauce into the creamy mixture. Mix thoroughly until the cheese has melted and the sauce is well combined. Expert Tip: - For an extra kick, consider using a sharper cheddar cheese or experimenting with a blend of cheeses like pepper jack. - Taste the sauce at this stage and adjust the buffalo sauce based on your spice preference.

  • Step 4: Combine Macaroni and Chicken

    Once your cheese sauce is ready, add the cooked macaroni and 2 cups of shredded cooked chicken to the saucepan. Stir well to coat the macaroni and chicken evenly with the sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
    Note:
    - Leftover rotisserie chicken works great for this recipe! Just shred it and mix it in.

  • Step 5: Bake the Dish

    Transfer the cheesy macaroni mixture into a greased baking dish. Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 15 minutes, or until heated through and bubbly.
    Tip:
    - For a crispy top, broil for an additional 2-3 minutes at the end of baking. Just be sure to watch closely to avoid burning.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I know when my elbow macaroni is al dente?

Al dente means 'to the tooth' in Italian. The pasta should be cooked so that it is firm to the bite, not soft or mushy. Start tasting it a minute or two before the package's suggested cooking time. It should have a slight resistance when bitten.

What should I do if my cheese sauce is too thick?

If your cheese sauce is too thick, you can add a little more milk, a tablespoon at a time, until you reach your desired consistency. Stir well to incorporate.

How can I shred cooked chicken easily?

To shred cooked chicken, use two forks to pull the meat apart. Alternatively, you can use a stand mixer with a paddle attachment to shred it quickly on low speed.

What type of buffalo sauce should I use?

You can use any bottled buffalo sauce that you prefer, but if you want to make your own, mix hot sauce with melted butter for a simple homemade version. Adjust the heat level according to your taste.

How can I make sure my baking dish doesn't stick?

To prevent sticking, lightly grease your baking dish with butter or non-stick cooking spray before adding your mac and cheese mixture. This will help it come out easily after baking.

What can I use if I don’t have cream cheese?

If you don’t have cream cheese, you can substitute with sour cream or a little more shredded cheese, though the texture might be slightly different.

Can I make this dish ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the mac and cheese mixture ahead of time, store it in the fridge, and then bake it when you're ready to serve. Just add an extra few minutes to the baking time if it's coming straight from the fridge.

How do I safely handle hot ingredients?

Always use oven mitts when handling hot pans or dishes. If you're pouring hot liquids, do it slowly to avoid splashes, and consider using a funnel for pouring sauces.

What should I do if I burn the cheese sauce?

If your cheese sauce starts to burn, immediately remove it from the heat. If it has only a slight burnt smell, you can try transferring it to a new pot without scraping the bottom to avoid the burnt bits.

How can I make my mac and cheese extra cheesy?

To make it extra cheesy, you can add more shredded cheese to the sauce or mix in different types of cheese, like mozzarella or pepper jack, for added flavor.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

To accommodate dietary preferences, consider using gluten-free elbow macaroni for a gluten-free version. For a lower-calorie option, substitute reduced-fat cream cheese and use a lower-fat cheese blend. For a vegetarian alternative, replace the shredded chicken with sautéed mushrooms or a medley of roasted vegetables and adjust the buffalo sauce to ensure it’s vegetarian-friendly. Additionally, for a dairy-free version, use plant-based cream cheese and a dairy-free cheese alternative.

Pairings

For a delightful pairing, serve Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese with a crisp side salad featuring mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, and a tangy vinaigrette to balance the richness of the dish. A side of garlic bread or cheesy breadsticks would also complement the flavors beautifully. For beverages, consider a cold, hoppy IPA or a refreshing lemonade to cut through the creaminess. Alternatively, a glass of Sauvignon Blanc can enhance the meal's overall experience with its citrus notes.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese in individual ramekins for a fun, portion-controlled presentation, or in a large baking dish for a family-style gathering. Top the dish with a sprinkle of chopped green onions or fresh parsley for a pop of color. For added texture, consider drizzling some extra buffalo sauce on top before serving. You can also serve it with extra cheese on top or breadcrumbs for a crunchy finish.

Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese

45 min
$10
600 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

DairyGluten

Dietary Tags:

Comfort FoodHigh Protein

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Main DishComfort Food

Tags:

EasyQuickFamily-Friendly

Description

Creamy, cheesy macaroni mixed with spicy buffalo chicken for a delicious twist on a classic dish.

Ingredients

  • elbow macaroni: 8 oz
  • shredded cheddar cheese: 2 cups
  • cream cheese: 4 oz
  • buffalo sauce: 1/2 cup
  • cooked chicken, shredded: 2 cups
  • butter: 2 tbsp
  • milk: 1 cup
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste

Date Created:

11/21/2024
